verses.plain: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

tokens.t: These
also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

verses.plain: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

tokens.t: the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings
to search out a matter.

verses.plain: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

tokens.t: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings
unsearchable.

verses.plain: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

tokens.t: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

verses.plain: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

tokens.t: Take away the wicked
before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

verses.plain: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

tokens.t: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great

verses.plain: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

tokens.t: For better
that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

verses.plain: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

tokens.t: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest
what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

verses.plain: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

tokens.t: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour
and discover not a secret to another:

verses.plain: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

tokens.t: Lest he that heareth
put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

verses.plain: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

tokens.t: A word fitly spoken
apples of gold in pictures of silver.

verses.plain: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

tokens.t: an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold,
a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

verses.plain: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

tokens.t: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest,
a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

verses.plain: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

tokens.t: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift
clouds and wind without rain.

verses.plain: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

tokens.t: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

verses.plain: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

tokens.t: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

verses.plain: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

tokens.t: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and
hate thee.

verses.plain: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

tokens.t: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour
a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

verses.plain: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

tokens.t: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble
a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

verses.plain: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

tokens.t: he that taketh away a garment in cold weather,
vinegar upon nitre, so
he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

verses.plain: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

tokens.t: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

verses.plain: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.

tokens.t: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the
shall reward thee.

verses.plain: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

tokens.t: The north wind driveth away rain: so
an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

verses.plain: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

tokens.t: better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

verses.plain: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

tokens.t: cold waters to a thirsty soul, so
good news from a far country.

verses.plain: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

tokens.t: A righteous man falling down before the wicked
a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

verses.plain: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.

tokens.t: not good to eat much honey: so
to search their own glory
glory.

verses.plain: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

tokens.t: He that
no rule over his own spirit
a city
broken down,
without walls.

footnotes.text: is…: Heb. there is no searching
Put…: Heb. Set not out thy glory
a secret…: or, the secret of
fitly…: Heb. spoken upon his wheels
of a…: Heb. in a gift of falsehood
Withdraw…: or, Let thy foot be seldom in
driveth…: or, bringeth forth rain: so doth a backbiting tongue an angry countenance
